com.xtremelabs.robolectric
Class RobolectricTestRunner

java.lang.Object
  org.junit.runner.Runner
      org.junit.runners.ParentRunner<org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod>
          org.junit.runners.BlockJUnit4ClassRunner
              com.xtremelabs.robolectric.RobolectricTestRunner
All Implemented Interfaces:
RobolectricTestRunnerInterface, org.junit.runner.Describable, org.junit.runner.manipulation.Filterable, org.junit.runner.manipulation.Sortable
public class RobolectricTestRunner
extends org.junit.runners.BlockJUnit4ClassRunner
implements RobolectricTestRunnerInterface

Installs a RobolectricClassLoader and ResourceLoader in order to provide a simulation of the Android runtime environment.

Constructor Detail

RobolectricTestRunner

public RobolectricTestRunner(java.lang.Class<?> testClass)
                      throws org.junit.runners.model.InitializationError
Creates a runner to run testClass. Looks in your working directory for your AndroidManifest.xml file and res directory.

Parameters:
testClass - the test class to be run
Throws:
org.junit.runners.model.InitializationError - if junit says so

RobolectricTestRunner

protected RobolectricTestRunner(java.lang.Class<?> testClass,
                                java.io.File androidManifestPath,
                                java.io.File resourceDirectory)
                         throws org.junit.runners.model.InitializationError
Call this constructor in subclasses in order to specify the location of the AndroidManifest.xml file and the resource directory. The #androidManifestPath is used to locate the AndroidManifest.xml file which, in turn, contains package name for the R class which contains the identifiers for all of the resources. The resource directory is where the resource loader will look for resources to load.

Parameters:
testClass - the test class to be run
androidManifestPath - the AndroidManifest.xml file
resourceDirectory - the directory containing the project's resources
Throws:
org.junit.runners.model.InitializationError - if junit says so

RobolectricTestRunner

protected RobolectricTestRunner(java.lang.Class<?> testClass,
                                java.lang.String androidManifestPath,
                                java.lang.String resourceDirectory)
                         throws org.junit.runners.model.InitializationError
Deprecated. Use RobolectricTestRunner(Class, File, File) instead.

Call this constructor in subclasses in order to specify the location of the AndroidManifest.xml file and the resource directory. The #androidManifestPath is used to locate the AndroidManifest.xml file which, in turn, contains package name for the R class which contains the identifiers for all of the resources. The resource directory is where the resource loader will look for resources to load.

Parameters:
testClass - the test class to be run
androidManifestPath - the relative path to the AndroidManifest.xml file
resourceDirectory - the relative path to the directory containing the project's resources
Throws:
org.junit.runners.model.InitializationError - if junit says so

RobolectricTestRunner

protected RobolectricTestRunner(java.lang.Class<?> testClass,
                                ClassHandler classHandler,
                                RobolectricClassLoader classLoader,
                                java.io.File androidManifestPath,
                                java.io.File resourceDirectory)
                         throws org.junit.runners.model.InitializationError
This is not the constructor you are looking for... probably. This constructor creates a bridge between the test runner called by JUnit and a second instance of the test runner that is loaded via the instrumenting class loader. This instrumented instance of the test runner, along with the instrumented instance of the actual test, provides access to Robolectric's features and the un-instrumented instance of the test runner delegates most of the interesting test runner behavior to it. Providing your own class handler and class loader here in order to get different functionality is a difficult and dangerous project. If you need to customize the project root and resource directory, use RobolectricTestRunner(Class, String, String). For other extensions, consider creating a subclass and overriding the documented methods of this class.

Parameters:
testClass - the test class to be run
classHandler - the ClassHandler to use to in shadow delegation
classLoader - the RobolectricClassLoader
androidManifestPath - the AndroidManifest.xml file
resourceDirectory - the directory containing the project's resources
Throws:
org.junit.runners.model.InitializationError - if junit says so

RobolectricTestRunner

                                ClassHandler classHandler,
                                RobolectricClassLoader classLoader,
                                java.lang.String androidManifestPath,
                                java.lang.String resourceDirectory)
                         throws org.junit.runners.model.InitializationError
Deprecated. Use RobolectricTestRunner(Class, ClassHandler, RobolectricClassLoader, File, File)

This is not the constructor you are looking for... probably. This constructor creates a bridge between the test runner called by JUnit and a second instance of the test runner that is loaded via the instrumenting class loader. This instrumented instance of the test runner, along with the instrumented instance of the actual test, provides access to Robolectric's features and the un-instrumented instance of the test runner delegates most of the interesting test runner behavior to it. Providing your own class handler and class loader here in order to get different functionality is a difficult and dangerous project. If you need to customize the project root and resource directory, use RobolectricTestRunner(Class, String, String). For other extensions, consider creating a subclass and overriding the documented methods of this class.

Parameters:
testClass - the test class to be run
classHandler - the ClassHandler to use to in shadow delegation
classLoader - the RobolectricClassLoader
androidManifestPath - the AndroidManifest.xml file
resourceDirectory - the directory containing the project's resources
Throws:
org.junit.runners.model.InitializationError - if junit says so

createApplication

protected android.app.Application createApplication()
Override this method if you want to provide your own implementation of Application. This method attempts to instantiate an application instance as specified by the AndroidManifest.xml.

Returns:
An instance of the Application class specified by the ApplicationManifest.xml or an instance of Application if not specified.
